wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive getting started content for the math learning application. Cover project overview, prerequisites (Node.js, PostgreSQL, Next.js), environment setup, database configuration, OAuth provider setup, and initial application launch. Include step-by-step installation instructions, environment variable configuration, database migration process, and first-time user experience. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common setup issues and explain the application's educational purpose and target audience.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Submission API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the task submission endpoint. Document the POST /api/tasks/submit endpoint including request/response schemas, authentication requirements, XP calculation logic, and error handling. Detail the TaskSubmissionRequest interface with taskId, topicSlug, isCorrect, baseXP, and difficulty parameters. Explain the XPService.submitCorrectTask method workflow, success/failure responses, and integration with the gamification system. Include practical examples of correct/incorrect submissions, authentication flow, and error scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: System Design Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive system design documentation for the math learning application. Explain the overall system architecture, technology stack selection rationale, and high-level design principles. Document the Next.js App Router structure, server-side rendering approach, and client-side hydration strategy. Describe the separation between frontend presentation layer and backend services. Include system boundaries, external integrations (PostgreSQL, NextAuth, Firebase), and deployment architecture. Address scalability considerations, performance optimization strategies, and security architecture.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Management System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the content management system that powers the interactive math learning platform. Explain the subject-based organization (Math, Algebra, Geometry, Physics), MDX lesson authoring system, topic configuration management, and dynamic content loading mechanisms. Document how lessons are structured with mathematical notation, how topics are configured with difficulty levels and prerequisites, and how the content loading system dynamically renders lessons and tasks. Include practical examples of creating new lessons, configuring topic parameters, and integrating mathematical formulas using KaTeX syntax.

wiki_catalogs.name: Subject Organization & Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the subject organization system that structures mathematical content across different disciplines. Explain how subjects (Math, Algebra, Geometry, Physics) are organized hierarchically with sections, subsections, and lessons. Document the JSON configuration structure including pageTitle, pageDescription, sections array with title and description, and lessons array with folder references. Include practical examples of adding new subjects, creating sections with proper metadata, and organizing lessons within topic folders. Show how the system supports multi-language content and maintains consistent navigation patterns across all subjects.

wiki_catalogs.name: XP Calculation Engine
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the XP calculation engine that determines experience point rewards for student achievements. Explain the core XP calculation formula, base task XP values, daily task limits, and multiplier tiers (full, half, low). Document the computeDailyMultiplier function logic, including how task position within daily limits affects XP rewards. Cover the submitCorrectTask workflow, XP accumulation mechanisms, and how XP contributes to level progression. Include practical examples showing XP calculations for different scenarios, daily task sequences, and multiplier applications. Address the integration with task submission API and real-time XP updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task System Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the task system architecture that powers the interactive learning interface. Explain the main Tasks component structure, task lifecycle management, state management patterns, and real-time XP calculation integration. Document the component hierarchy including task filtering, completion tracking, and user progress visualization. Include detailed explanations of the task submission flow, audio feedback system, and dynamic task rendering based on type. Provide practical examples of task integration patterns, state synchronization with the XP service, and error handling strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture & Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the math learning application. Describe the high-level system design, Next.js App Router architecture, component hierarchy, and data flow patterns. Document the clean architecture principles, domain-driven design implementation, and separation of concerns between UI, business logic, and data layers. Explain the authentication architecture with NextAuth, database design with Prisma, and real-time XP calculation system. Include system boundaries, integration patterns, and technology stack rationale.

wiki_catalogs.name: XP Retrieval API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the XP retrieval endpoint. Document the GET /api/xp/user endpoint including authentication requirements, response schema for user XP data, progress tracking information, and level calculations. Explain the XPService methods for retrieving user progress, topic mastery data, streak information, and daily XP limits. Include examples of successful responses, authentication errors, and data structure formats for frontend consumption.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Hierarchy & UI Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed component architecture documentation for the application's UI structure. Document the hierarchical organization of React components, from root layout providers to individual UI elements. Explain the provider pattern implementation with SessionWrapper and ThemeProvider. Detail component composition patterns, prop drilling prevention strategies, and state management approaches. Include component lifecycle management, reusability patterns, and styling architecture. Document the relationship between layout components, page components, and reusable UI elements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Learning Interface
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the interactive learning interface that facilitates student engagement with mathematical content. Explain the task system architecture supporting multiple-choice and input-based questions, lesson progression tracking, difficulty scaling, and adaptive content delivery. Document the component hierarchy, task rendering logic, user interaction patterns, and real-time feedback mechanisms. Include practical examples of task creation, component integration, and user workflow optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: MDX Lesson Authoring & Rendering
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the MDX lesson authoring system that enables rich mathematical content creation. Explain MDX syntax for embedding interactive elements, mathematical notation using KaTeX, and lesson structure organization. Document how lessons are loaded dynamically through loadLesson.ts, how mathematical formulas are rendered with proper syntax, and how content integrates with the task system. Include practical examples of writing lessons with mathematical expressions, embedding interactive components, creating problem-solving scenarios, and structuring content for optimal learning flow. Address best practices for lesson organization, content validation, and performance optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Anti-Grind Mechanics
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the anti-grind system that prevents XP farming and encourages balanced learning patterns. Explain the daily task counter mechanism, task sequencing logic, and tiered multiplier system (dailyFullTasks vs dailyHalfTasks). Document how the system tracks dailyTasksCount per topic, resets daily counters appropriately, and applies progressive fatigue multipliers. Cover the computeDailyMultiplier algorithm, task position calculations, and how the system maintains learning quality over quantity. Include examples of daily XP progression, fatigue effects, and optimal learning patterns that maximize XP efficiency while preventing exploitation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Multiple Choice Tasks
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the multiple choice task component system. Explain the task rendering logic, answer selection handling, immediate feedback mechanisms, and correctness validation. Document the component props structure, event handling patterns, and integration with the main task system. Include examples of task configuration, answer shuffling algorithms, and accessibility features. Address styling patterns, responsive design considerations, and user interaction optimization for mathematical multiple choice questions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the core educational features of the math learning application. Explain the interactive lesson system with MDX content, gamified XP progression system, spaced repetition system (SRS), multi-format task system, and progress tracking mechanisms. Document how these features work together to create an engaging learning experience, including the anti-grind mechanics, mastery-based progression, and adaptive content delivery. Provide practical examples of each feature in action.

wiki_catalogs.name: Topic Synchronization API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the topic synchronization endpoint. Document the GET /api/sync-topics endpoint including authentication requirements, topic configuration synchronization logic, and content management workflows. Explain the syncTopicConfigs functionality for updating topic metadata, difficulty levels, and learning parameters. Detail the response schema for synchronized topic data, cache management, and integration with the content delivery system. Include examples of synchronization requests and responses.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow & State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data flow documentation for the application's state management and data handling patterns. Document the flow from user interactions through components to services and database operations. Explain the XP calculation pipeline, task submission workflow, and real-time data updates. Detail the authentication state flow, session management, and protected route handling. Include data transformation patterns, caching strategies, and error propagation mechanisms. Address asynchronous data loading, optimistic updates, and conflict resolution strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Gamification System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the gamification system that motivates and rewards student learning progress. Explain the XP calculation engine with anti-grind mechanics, level progression system (0-5 levels), streak management, daily limits, and mastery-based progression. Document the XP anti-grind formula, fatigue calculation, reward structures, and how gamification elements encourage consistent practice. Include practical examples of XP calculations, level advancement, streak maintenance, and progress visualization through badges and indicators.

wiki_catalogs.name: Topic Configuration & Parameters
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the topic configuration system that manages learning parameters and behavioral settings. Explain the config.json structure including difficulty levels, mastery thresholds, prerequisite requirements, and SRS parameters. Document how topic configurations integrate with the XP system, how difficulty scales are defined, and how prerequisite relationships affect content access. Include practical examples of configuring new topics, setting up mastery milestones, defining review intervals, and establishing learning pathways. Address configuration validation, parameter optimization, and how changes propagate through the system via syncTopicConfigs.ts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Level Progression System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the level progression system that provides clear achievement milestones for learners. Explain the computeLevelFromThresholds algorithm, default level thresholds ([1000, 2500, 4500, 7000, 10000]), and level calculation logic. Document how users start at level 0 and advance through predefined XP milestones, including level boundary calculations and progress bar implementations. Cover the synchronization between UserTopicXp.level and UserTaskAttempt.masteryLevel, level advancement triggers, and how level progression integrates with the overall gamification experience. Include examples of level transitions, threshold calculations, and visual progress indicators.

wiki_catalogs.name: Input-based Tasks
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the input-based task component system. Explain mathematical input handling, answer validation logic, and formatting requirements for numerical and algebraic responses. Document the component's integration with the main task system, correctness checking algorithms, and user feedback mechanisms. Include examples of input validation patterns, mathematical notation support, and accessibility features for screen readers. Address error handling for invalid inputs, input sanitization, and real-time validation feedback.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication & Authorization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed authentication system documentation covering NextAuth v5 configuration, multi-provider OAuth setup (Google, GitHub, Facebook), email/password authentication, session management, and role-based access control. Document the authentication flow, security considerations, token handling, and user session persistence. Include provider-specific configuration, custom server actions, and integration with the Next.js App Router. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common authentication issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for NextAuth authentication endpoints. Document the comprehensive authentication flow including OAuth provider endpoints, session management, token handling, and user registration. Explain the NextAuth configuration, supported providers (Google, GitHub, Facebook), callback handling, and session persistence. Detail the authentication middleware, protected routes, and integration with the user management system. Include examples of authentication flows, session responses, and error handling for failed authentications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Design & Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed database integration documentation covering the Prisma ORM implementation and database design patterns. Document the entity relationship model, table schemas, and data modeling decisions. Explain the repository pattern implementation, query optimization strategies, and transaction management. Detail the integration between Prisma models and TypeScript interfaces. Include database migration strategies, schema evolution patterns, and data consistency mechanisms. Address performance considerations, indexing strategies, and backup/recovery procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Spaced Repetition System (SRS)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Spaced Repetition System that optimizes long-term retention through intelligent review scheduling. Explain the SRS algorithm implementation, mastery stage tracking, review interval management, hot/cold topic indicators, and adaptive scheduling based on performance. Document the mathematical formulas for interval calculation, ease factor adjustment, and forgetting curve modeling. Include practical examples of review scheduling, mastery progression, and topic prioritization based on retention probability.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dynamic Content Loading & Task Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the dynamic content loading system that fetches and renders lessons with integrated tasks. Explain how loadLesson.ts and loadTasks.ts work together to assemble complete learning experiences, how task generators create dynamic content variations, and how different task formats (MCQ, input) are integrated into lessons. Document the file organization structure for tasks, the task loading pipeline, and how content is cached and optimized for performance. Include practical examples of creating task generators, implementing custom task types, organizing task files, and debugging content loading issues. Address content versioning, task randomization, and maintaining consistency across different device types.

wiki_catalogs.name: Streak Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the streak management system that tracks consecutive learning activity and rewards consistency. Explain streak calculation logic, daily activity tracking through lastPracticedDate, and streak preservation mechanisms during SRS review periods. Document how streaks influence XP multipliers, special bonus rewards, and streak-based achievements. Cover streak reset conditions, streak visualization in the UI, and integration with daily XP calculations. Include examples of streak growth patterns, reset scenarios, and how streak management complements the overall gamification strategy to encourage regular practice.

wiki_catalogs.name: Lesson Progression & Navigation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the lesson progression system that manages task sequencing, completion tracking, and user navigation. Explain the available tasks filtering logic, completion state management, and automatic task advancement. Detail the navigation controls, progress indicators, and milestone achievements. Include examples of lesson loading patterns, task availability algorithms, and user journey optimization. Address edge cases like empty task sets, task reordering, and progress persistence across sessions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive database design documentation covering the Prisma schema, entity relationships, and data models. Detail the User, TopicXpConfig, UserTopicXp, and UserTaskAttempt entities with their relationships and constraints. Document the database migration strategy, seed data management, and data integrity rules. Explain the XP calculation data model, task attempt tracking, and progress persistence. Include database diagram, indexing strategy, and performance considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Progress Tracking & Analytics
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the progress tracking and analytics system that monitors student learning journey and performance metrics. Explain user progress tracking, topic mastery visualization, performance analytics, streak monitoring, and achievement systems. Document the data models for progress storage, analytics aggregation, real-time progress updates, and dashboard visualization components. Include practical examples of progress reporting, analytics queries, and performance insights generation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Progress Visualization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for progress visualization components that display learner achievements and milestones. Explain the ProgressBadge component implementation, XP progress bars, level indicators, and mastery displays. Document how progress data flows from XPService to UI components, real-time progress updates, and visual feedback mechanisms. Cover badge styling, progress animation, hot/cold topic indicators, and integration with theme switching. Include examples of component usage, data binding patterns, and customization options for different visual representations of learning progress.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Feedback & Interaction
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the user feedback and interaction system within the learning interface. Explain the real-time feedback mechanisms, audio cue integration, visual progress indicators, and XP reward display. Document the authentication-aware controls, user state management, and personalized learning experience features. Include examples of feedback timing, sound effect integration, and accessibility considerations. Address error messaging, loading states, and user guidance throughout the learning process.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation covering all REST endpoints in the application. Document the task submission API with request/response schemas and XP calculation logic, the XP retrieval API for user progress tracking, the topic synchronization API for content management, and NextAuth authentication endpoints. Include HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response formats, authentication requirements, error handling, and rate limiting. Provide practical examples and integration guidelines.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Library
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed component library documentation covering all reusable UI components. Document header components, modal systems, user interface elements, task components (MCQ and input-based), progress visualization components, and theme switching functionality. For each component, describe props, usage patterns, styling options, accessibility features, and integration examples. Include component composition patterns and customization guidelines.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Authoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content authoring documentation covering MDX lesson creation, mathematical notation using KaTeX, task generation system, and content synchronization. Document the lesson structure, task creation guidelines, content generation scripts, and topic configuration management. Explain how to create interactive lessons with mathematical expressions, generate dynamic practice problems, and maintain content consistency across subjects. Include authoring best practices and content validation processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive development guide covering local development setup, build configuration, code quality standards, and deployment preparation. Document the TypeScript configuration, ESLint rules, PostCSS setup, Prisma development workflow, and npm script usage. Include development best practices, debugging techniques, testing strategies, and performance optimization. Provide guidance for contributors and explain the project's development philosophy and coding standards.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>

# Math Learning Application - Next.js Project Analysis

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
This is a comprehensive mathematics learning platform built with Next.js that combines interactive lessons, gamified task completion, and spaced repetition system (SRS) for effective knowledge retention. The application provides structured math education across multiple subjects including algebra, geometry, and physics.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- **Interactive Learning**: Deliver engaging math lessons through MDX content with mathematical notation support
- **Gamification**: Implement XP (Experience Points) system with level progression and streak management
- **Spaced Repetition**: Utilize scientifically-proven SRS algorithm for optimal knowledge retention
- **Multi-subject Support**: Cover mathematics, algebra, geometry, and physics education
- **Authentication**: Provide secure user authentication with multiple OAuth providers

### Target Audience
- Students seeking structured math education
- Learners preparing for academic assessments
- Educators looking for interactive teaching tools
- Anyone interested in gamified learning experiences

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The application follows a modular Next.js architecture with clear separation of concerns:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Root Layout] --> B[Header Navigation]
    A --> C[Main Content Area]
    A --> D[Session Provider]
    
    C --> E[Subject Pages]
    E --> F[Math Lessons]
    E --> G[Algebra Content]
    E --> H[Geometry Lessons]
    E --> I[Physics Topics]
    
    C --> J[Auth Routes]
    J --> K[Sign In Pages]
    J --> L[Callback Handlers]
    
    C --> M[API Endpoints]
    M --> N[XP Calculation Service]
    M --> O[Task Submission Handler]
    M --> P[User Progress API]
```

### Design Patterns
- **Repository Pattern**: Used extensively in XPService for database operations
- **Provider Pattern**: SessionWrapper manages authentication state throughout the app
- **Factory Pattern**: Dynamic component rendering based on task types
- **Observer Pattern**: Real-time XP updates and progress tracking

### System Relationships
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    Client[Browser Client] --> NextAuth[NextAuth Session]
    Client --> API[REST API]
    
    API --> XPService[XP Service Layer]
    API --> AuthConfig[Auth Configuration]
    
    XPService --> Prisma[Prisma ORM]
    Prisma --> PostgreSQL[(PostgreSQL Database)]
    
    AuthConfig --> Prisma
    
    Client --> Components[React Components]
    Components --> Firebase[Firebase Services]
    Components --> KaTeX[Math Rendering]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Root Layout**: `app/layout.tsx` - Central application wrapper with theme provider and session management
- **Home Page**: `app/(main)/page.tsx` - Landing page structure
- **Auth Layout**: `app/(auth)/auth/` - Authentication routes and modals

### Core Modules
- **XP System**: `lib/xp/xpService.ts` - Comprehensive experience calculation and SRS implementation
- **Task Management**: `components/tasks/Tasks.tsx` - Interactive quiz interface with audio feedback
- **Content Loading**: `lib/loadTasks.ts` - Dynamic task loading from JSON files
- **Authentication**: `lib/auth/authConfig.ts` - Multi-provider OAuth configuration

### Configuration Approach
- **Database Schema**: `prisma/schema.prisma` - Defines User, TopicXpConfig, UserTopicXp, and UserTaskAttempt models
- **Build Configuration**: `next.config.ts` - Image optimization settings for Google profile pictures
- **Type Definitions**: `types/` - Comprehensive TypeScript interfaces for all domain objects

### External Dependencies
Key dependencies include:
- **Next.js 16.0.7**: Framework foundation
- **Next-Auth v5**: Authentication system with multiple OAuth providers
- **Prisma**: Database ORM with PostgreSQL adapter
- **KaTeX**: Mathematical formula rendering
- **React Hook Form**: Form validation and state management

### Integration Points
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant User
    participant TaskComp as Task Component
    participant API as API Route
    participant XPService as XP Service
    participant DB as Prisma/PostgreSQL
    
    User ->> TaskComp: Submit Answer
    TaskComp ->> API: POST /api/tasks/submit
    API ->> XPService: submitCorrectTask()
    XPService ->> DB: Transaction Operations
    DB -->> XPService: Updated Records
    XPService -->> API: XP Result
    API -->> TaskComp: Response
    TaskComp -->> User: Feedback & XP Update
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
- **Interactive Math Lessons**: MDX-based content with LaTeX math notation support
- **Gamified Learning**: XP system with levels, streaks, and daily limits
- **Spaced Repetition**: Intelligent review scheduling based on learning curves
- **Multi-format Tasks**: Multiple choice and input-based question formats
- **Progress Tracking**: Visual progress indicators and completion badges

### Implementation Highlights
- **Dynamic Content Loading**: `content/math/addition_and_subtraction_of_fractions/index.mdx` - Structured lesson content
- **Task Generation**: `content/math/addition_and_subtraction_of_fractions/tasks/generator.ts` - Automated question generation
- **Progress Visualization**: `components/math/ProgressBadge.tsx` - Real-time completion tracking
- **Audio Feedback**: Interactive sound effects for correct/incorrect answers

### Feature Architecture
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Loading
    Loading --> LessonContent: Load MDX
    LessonContent --> TaskInterface: Start Practice
    TaskInterface --> AnswerSubmission: User Input
    AnswerSubmission --> XPProcessing: Correct Answer
    AnswerSubmission --> TaskInterface: Incorrect Answer
    XPProcessing --> LevelUp: XP Threshold
    XPProcessing --> TaskInterface: Continue Practice
    LevelUp --> TaskInterface: New Level
    TaskInterface --> LessonContent: Complete Topic
    LessonContent --> [*]: Complete
```

## 5. Conclusion and Recommendations

### Project Architecture Summary
This Next.js application demonstrates a well-structured educational platform with sophisticated learning mechanics. The architecture successfully combines modern web development practices with proven pedagogical techniques like spaced repetition and gamification.

### Architectural Strengths
- **Clean Separation of Concerns**: Clear module boundaries between UI, business logic, and data layers
- **Scalable Database Design**: Well-normalized Prisma schema supporting complex learning analytics
- **Extensible Content System**: Modular content structure enabling easy addition of new topics
- **Robust Authentication**: Flexible OAuth integration supporting multiple identity providers

### Potential Improvement Areas
- **Performance Optimization**: Consider implementing caching strategies for frequently accessed content
- **Testing Coverage**: Expand unit and integration tests for critical XP calculation logic
- **Accessibility**: Enhance screen reader support and keyboard navigation
- **Mobile Experience**: Optimize touch interactions and responsive design elements

### Actionable Recommendations
1. **Implement Content Caching**: Add Redis caching layer for lesson content and user progress data
2. **Add Comprehensive Testing**: Develop test suites for XPService calculations and authentication flows
3. **Enhance Analytics**: Integrate learning analytics to track student progress patterns
4. **Improve Error Handling**: Implement more granular error boundaries and user feedback mechanisms

### Next Steps for Project Evolution
- **Advanced Analytics Dashboard**: Build insights into learning patterns and effectiveness
- **Social Learning Features**: Add peer comparison and collaborative learning capabilities
- **Offline Support**: Implement service worker for offline content access
- **Mobile App Development**: Consider React Native port for native mobile experience

**Sources:**
- [package.json](package.json)
- [next.config.ts](next.config.ts)
- [app/layout.tsx](app/layout.tsx)
- [components/Header.tsx](components/Header.tsx)
- [components/tasks/Tasks.tsx](components/tasks/Tasks.tsx)
- [lib/xp/xpService.ts](lib/xp/xpService.ts)
- [types/xp.ts](types/xp.ts)
- [content/math/addition_and_subtraction_of_fractions/index.mdx](content/math/addition_and_subtraction_of_fractions/index.mdx)
- [lib/loadTasks.ts](lib/loadTasks.ts)
- [lib/auth/authConfig.ts](lib/auth/authConfig.ts)
- [app/api/tasks/submit/route.ts](app/api/tasks/submit/route.ts)
- [prisma/schema.prisma](prisma/schema.prisma)

</blog>
